title: Hazard-Impact Event Dataset - The Montandon Schema
description: The data allows the user to assemble many different hazard-impact estimates, potentially for different impact types, across different organisations and with spatio-temporal coverage, and more. The structure and form of this dataset conforms with the Montandon Data Standards.

monty_Info.title: Monty Object Instance-Specific Information
monty_Info.description: Information about this Montandon object instance and general information on the data within this instance.

class_version.title: Montandon Version
class_version.description: The version of the Montandon from which the data was extracted.

db_pubdate.title: Date of Publication
db_pubdate.description: The date this data was published in the Montandon database.

helpful_resources.title: Helpful Monty-Related Resources
helpful_resources.description: A few helpful resources that may help the user through their journey into Monty's world!

event_Level.title: Event-Level Metadata
event_Level.description: This section describes all the event-level information, without listing any information about impacts or the specific hazards involved. Note that an 'event' is defined as the occurrence of a single or multiple hazards.

impact_Data.title: Impact Data
impact_Data.description: A collection of impact estimate data

hazard_Data.title: Hazard Data
hazard_Data.description: A collection of hazard severity estimate data

taxonomies.title: Montandon Taxonomy Codes
taxonomies.description: The full list of required taxonomy codes necessary to interpret the data

ISO_info.title: Country and Region Information
ISO_info.description: Information concerning the country, such as ISO3C code, country name, region, continent, etc.

ISO3.title: ISO3 Character Code
ISO3.description: The character-based three letter country code with respect to the alpha-3 ISO 3166-1 standard

country.title: Country Name
enum: The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia

region_UN.title: UN-Defined Region
region_UN.description: The region, as defined by the UN

region_WB.title: World Bank-Defined Region
region_WB.description: The region, as defined by the World Bank

subregion_UN.title: UN-Defined Sub-Region
subregion_UN.description: The sub-region, as defined by the UN

income_WB.title: Country Income Group
income_WB.description: The country income group, as defined by the World Bank

imp_class.title: Impact Taxonomy
imp_class.description: The taxonomy of the different impact categorisations

imp_det_code.title: Impact Detail Code
imp_det_code.description: The code of the impact detail

imp_det_lab.title: Impact Detail Label
imp_det_lab.description: The label or full name of the impact detail

imp_subcat_code.title: Impact Sub-Category Code
imp_subcat_code.description: The code for the impact sub-category

imp_subcat_lab.title: Impact Sub-Category Label
imp_subcat_lab.description: The label or full name of the impact sub-category
enum: Transportation Systems (Roads, Railways, Harbours, Airports, etc)

imp_cat_code.title: Impact Category Code
imp_cat_code.description: The code of the impact category

imp_cat_lab.title: Impact Category Label
imp_cat_lab.description: The label or full name of the impact category

haz_class.title: Hazard Taxonomy
haz_class.description: The taxonomy of the different hazard categorisations

haz_spec_code.title: Specific Hazard Code
haz_spec_code.description: The coded name of the specific hazard

haz_spec_lab.title: Specific Hazard Name
haz_spec_lab.description: The name of the specific hazard
enum: Geomagnetic Storm (including energetic particles related to space weather, and solar flare radio blackout [R Scale])
Earthquake Surface Rupture, Fissures, and Tectonic Uplift/Subsidence
Subsidence and Uplift, Including Shoreline Change (Earthquake Trigger)
Subsidence and Uplift, Including Shoreline Change (Magmatic/Volcanic Trigger)
Ground Shaking (induced earthquake, reservoir fill, dams, cavity collapse, underground explosion, impact, hydrocarbon fields, shale exploration, etc.)
Subsidence and Uplift Including Shoreline Change
Levels of Contaminants in Food and Feed
Foodborne Microbial Hazards (including human enteric virus and foodborne parasite)
Viral, Mycoplasma and Viroid Plant Disease Epidemics
Shrimp disease (bacterial) - Acute Hepatic pancreatic necrosis
Safety Hazards Associated with Oil and Gas Extraction Activities

haz_cluster_code.title: Hazard Cluster Code
haz_cluster_code.description: The coded name of the hazard cluster

haz_cluster_lab.title: Hazard Cluster Name
haz_cluster_lab.description: The name of the hazard cluster
enum: CBRNE (Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear and Explosive)

haz_type_code.title: Hazard Type Code
haz_type_code.description: The coded name of the hazard type

haz_type_lab.title: Hazard Type Label
haz_type_lab.description: The name of the hazard type

src_info.title: Source Information
src_info.description: The list of all source information relevant to this specific dataset.

src_org_lab.title: Organisation Label Name
src_org_lab.description: The organisation name, in the format '<name> (<acronym>)'.

src_org_typecode.title: Organisation Type Code
src_org_typecode.description: The code name of the organisation type. See the taxonomy for organisation type under 'organtypes'.

src_org_typelab.title: Organisation Type Label
src_org_typelab.description: The label name of the organisation type. See the taxonomy for organisation type under 'organtypes'.

src_org_email.title: Impact Data Source Contact Email
src_org_email.description: Email address of the source organisation that hosts the impact data estimate.

src_db_code.title: Database Coded Name
src_db_code.description: The coded name of the database.

src_db_lab.title: Database Label Name
src_db_lab.description: The label name of the database.

src_db_attr.title: Organisation Attribution to Database
src_db_attr.description: The attribution of the database to the source organisation. For example, the curator.

src_db_lic.title: Database License Information
src_db_lic.description: Information concerning the license and proprietary information for the database.

src_db_URL.title: Impact Data Source URL
src_db_URL.description: The website URL where the impact estimate was published

src_addinfo.title: Impact Data Source Additional Information
src_addinfo.description: Any additional comments or information about the dataset or the source organisation.

units_info.title: Units Taxonomy
units_info.description: The full list of taxonomies of the units.

unit_codes.title: Unit Code
unit_codes.description: The coded name of the unit.

units_lab.title: Unit Name
units_lab.description: The label name of the unit.

Bond Markets Unit European Monetary Unit (E.M.U.-6)
Bond Markets Unit European Unit of Account 9 (E.U.A.-9)
Bond Markets Unit European Unit of Account 17 (E.U.A.-17)
Codes specifically reserved for testing purposes
The codes assigned for transactions where no currency is involved

unit_groups_code.title: Unit Group Code
unit_groups_code.description: The code of the hierarchical group that the unit belongs to.

unit_groups_lab.title: Unit Group Label
unit_groups_lab.description: The name of the hierarchical group that the unit belongs to.

est_type.title: Estimation Type
est_type.description: The full list of taxonomies of the estimation type.

est_type_code.title: Estimate Type Code
est_type_code.description: The codes that describe the estimate types

est_type_lab.title: Estimate Type Label
est_type_lab.description: The label that describes the estimate types

spatial_coverage.title: Spatial Coverage Taxonomy
spatial_coverage.description: The full list of taxonomies of the spatial coverage.

spat_cov_code.title: General Spatial Coverage Codes
spat_cov_code.description: The codes for the most succinct grouping of spatial coverage data, including polygon, point and line data

spat_cov_lab.title: General Spatial Coverage Names
spat_cov_lab.description: The labels for the most succinct grouping of spatial coverage data, including polygon, point and line data
enum: Aggregated to administrative level or specific region outline/shape

Event_obj.title: Event-Level Information
Event_obj.description: Information about the event, without taking into account any impact estimates or hazard data.

ID_linkage.title: Event IDs and Names
ID_linkage.description: Event ID information and names of the event in different languages.

event_ID.title: Event ID
event_ID.description: Event-level identifier code that is unique and distinct from that of any other hazard occurrence, we generate this by condensing the abbreviated hazard title (e.g. EQ for earthquake), the event start date, and the countries affected (separated by commas)

ev_name.title: Event Name
ev_name.description: Name of the event, for general use, in any given language.

ev_name_lang.title: Event Name Language
ev_name_lang.description: Language the event name is provided in, values correspond to the ISO 639-2 (alpha-3b) standard language codes. Values were taken from https://datahub.io/core/language-codes/r/language-codes-full.csv

ext_IDs.title: External IDs
ext_IDs.description: List of ID codes that are used by external organisations (outside of the Montandon) to uniquely identify the hazard event. For example, GLIDE numbers.

spatial.title: Event IDs and Names
spatial.description: Event ID information and names of the event in different languages.

ev_ISO3s.title: Country ISO3 Codes
ev_ISO3s.description: List of countries affected, by ISO3 code.

gen_location.title: General Descriptive Event Location
gen_location.description: Brief character description of where the event took place, this is unimportant but could be used to check the spatial-information of the data at a later stage

regions.title: Continents or regions
regions.description: List of continents or regions affected

temporal.title: Time-Related Data
temporal.description: Data related to dates and time periods of the hazards. Note that, for multiple hazards, the event start and end dates would be the minimum and the maximum dates over all of the hazards.

ev_sdate.title: Event Start Date
ev_sdate.description: Start date of the hazard event. For unclear start dates, please use the earliest plausible date.

ev_fdate.title: Event End Date
ev_fdate.description: End date of the hazard event. For unclear end dates, please use the latest plausible date. Please note that this is when the hazard ended, not when the post-disaster recovery was achieved.

allhaz_class.title: Taxonomy of All Hazards
allhaz_class.description: Classification of the hazards associated to the event, with respect to the UNDRR-ISC 2020 Hazard Information Profiles report.

all_hazs_Ab.title: Abbreviated Hazard ID
all_hazs_Ab.description: Two-letter abbreviated ID for the hazards. For example, floods would be 'FL' and earthquakes 'EQ'. These abbreviations are pre-determined and standardised, and should be found online.

all_hazs_type.title: All Hazard Types
all_hazs_type.description: The most concise categorisation of the hazards, into eight categories. Please see the UNDRR-ISC 2020 Hazard Information Profiles report for more information.

all_hazs_cluster.title: All Hazard Clusters
all_hazs_cluster.description: The second layer in the categorisation of the hazards. Please see the UNDRR-ISC 2020 Hazard Information Profiles report for more information.

all_hazs_spec.title: All Specific Hazards
all_hazs_spec.description: The specific hazards is the final layer in the categorisation of the hazards. Please see the UNDRR-ISC 2020 Hazard Information Profiles report for more information.

Impact_obj.title: Impact Object of Montandon
Impact_obj.description: 'Disaster impact is the total effect, including negative effects (e.g., economic losses) and positive effects (e.g., economic gains), of a hazardous event or a disaster. The term includes economic, human and environmental impacts, and may include death, injuries, disease and other negative effects on human physical, mental and social well-being'. UNDRR - https://www.undrr.org/terminology/disaster

ID_linkage.title: Impact ID and Links
ID_linkage.description: Impact ID information and links to other object instances within an event. For example, linking to hazard IDs. Note: no spatial IDs are linked here, see the spatial element.

event_ID.title: Event ID
event_ID.description: ID of the overall event that this impact estimate refers to

imp_sub_ID.title: Impact Estimate ID
imp_sub_ID.description: ID of each impact element, within the overall event

haz_sub_ID.title: Hazard ID Link
haz_sub_ID.description: ID of each hazard event data element, within the overall event

source.title: Impact Data Source Information
source.description: Information regarding the source of the impact data

imp_src_db.title: Impact Data Source Database
imp_src_db.description: The database name from where the impact estimate was extracted

imp_src_org.title: Impact Data Source Organisation
imp_src_org.description: The organisation who published the impact estimate

imp_src_URL.title: Impact Data Source URL
imp_src_URL.description: The website URL where the impact data was published

impact_estimate.title: Impact Value Data
impact_estimate.description: Impact estimate value and unit information

imp_value.title: Estimated Impact Value
imp_value.description: The estimated value of the impact, as a number, without the units. For example, for an estimate of 1000 people displaced, you would enter 1000.

imp_type.title: Estimated Impact Value Type
imp_type.description: The estimated value type of the impact. For example, for an estimate of 1000 people displaced, the value type is people displaced, thus you would enter 'imptypedisp'. Please use the ImpactInformationProfiles.csv file to help find the coded name of the impact type.

imp_units.title: Impact Estimate Units
imp_units.description: The units of the impact estimate. For example, 10 deaths would be a count value, thus 'unitscountnum' should be used.

imp_unitdate.title: Impact Estimate Unit Date
imp_unitdate.description: If the impact estimate is a cost, please provide the date that the estimate was made on, to adjust for currency value and inflation. If no value is provided, imp_sdate will be used.

imp_est_type.title: Impact Estimate Data Type
imp_est_type.description: What was the type of data source that was used to create this impact estimate? Primary data? Secondary data? Modelled data: was it estimated without any event-specific data?

impact_taxonomy.title: Impact Categorisation
impact_taxonomy.description: Description of the categorisation of the impact estimate with respect to the IFRC Impact Information Profiles (IIPs).

imp_cat.title: Impact Category
imp_cat.description: The most concise categorisation of the impacts, into four categories: population, environmental, infrastructure and economy.

imp_subcat.title: Impact Sub-Category
imp_subcat.description: The sub-category of impact, which breaks down further from the very condensed four categories into more descriptive sub-categories, but doesn't go all the way into the specific assets or population demographics that could have been impacted by the hazard.

imp_det.title: Impact Detail
imp_det.description: The sub-sub category of impact, which is the specific asset or population demographic that has been impacted by the hazard.

temporal.title: Time-Related Data
temporal.description: Data related to dates and time periods of the impact estimates

imp_sdate.title: Impact Start Date
imp_sdate.description: Starting date of the impact estimate. For example, the total cost of a disaster and the number of people displaced is usually estimated between two dates. The start date would be the earliest date that the impact estimate covers. Some estimates like the death toll might have been made within the first few days or weeks of the event, and thus reflects the impact estimate based on preliminary data.

imp_fdate.title: Impact End Date
imp_fdate.description: Final date of the impact estimate. For example, the total cost of a disaster and the number of people displaced is usually estimated between two dates. The end date would be the latest date that the impact estimate covers. Some estimates like the death toll might have been made within the first few days or weeks of the event, and thus reflects the impact estimate based on preliminary data. Note: if the impact estimate is a stock estimate, such that it makes a statement only about a given day (e.g. 'there were 1000 people still displaced on March 12th' instead of 'there were 1000 people displaced between March 5th to April 5th'), then the end date is the same as the start date (imp_sdate = imp_fdate).

spatial.title: Spatial-Related Data
spatial.description: Data related to the spatial coverage of the impact estimates

Hazard_obj.title: Hazard Object for Montandon
Hazard_obj.description: 'A process, phenomenon or human activity that may cause loss of life, injury or other health impacts, property damage, social and economic disruption or environmental degradation.' UNDRR - https://www.undrr.org/terminology/hazard

ID_linkage.title: Hazard and Event ID
ID_linkage.description: Impact ID information and links to other object instances within an event. Note: no spatial IDs are linked here, see the spatial element.

event_ID.title: Event ID
event_ID.description: ID of the overall event that this hazard refers to

haz_sub_ID.title: Hazard Event ID
haz_sub_ID.description: ID of each hazard event, within the overall event

haz_ext_IDs.title: External IDs
haz_ext_IDs.description: List of ID codes that are used by external organisations (outside of the Montandon) to uniquely identify the hazard event. For example, GLIDE numbers.

source.title: Hazard Data Source Information
source.description: Information regarding the source of the impact data

haz_src_db.title: Hazard Data Source Database
haz_src_db.description: The database name from where the hazard data was extracted

haz_src_org.title: Hazard Data Source Organisation
haz_src_org.description: The organisation who published the hazard data

haz_src_URL.title: Hazard Data Source URL
haz_src_URL.description: The website URL where the hazard data was published

hazard_detail.title: Basic Hazard Information
hazard_detail.description: Basic information about the hazard, including things like the maximum magnitude/intensity/severity values and any related trigger/triggering/concurrent hazards (observed or even potential).

haz_maxvalue.title: Maximum Hazard Severity Value
haz_maxvalue.description: The estimated maximum hazard intensity/magnitude/severity value, as a number, without the units.

haz_maxunits.title: Maximum Hazard Severity Units
haz_maxunits.description: The units of the estimated hazard intensity/magnitude/severity.

haz_est_type.title: Hazard Data Estimate Type
haz_est_type.description: What was the type of data source that was used to create this hazard intensity/magnitude/severity estimate? Primary data? Secondary data? Modelled data: was it estimated without any event-specific data?

concur_haz.title: Concurrent Hazard Linkage
concur_haz.description: Linking the observed and potentially unobserved hazards linked to each specific hazard in the event.

haz_sub_ID.title: Monty-Based Hazard IDs
haz_sub_ID.description: The ID of the specific hazard that is linked to this hazard instance entry, using the Montandon ID. If the hazard is not in Montandon, leave this blank.

linkhaz_ext_IDs.title: Linked External IDs
linkhaz_ext_IDs.description: List of ID codes that are used by external organisations (outside of the Montandon) to uniquely identify the hazard event. For example, GLIDE numbers.

linkhaz_spec.title: Specific Hazard of Linked Hazard
linkhaz_spec.description: The specific hazard is the final layer in the categorisation of the hazards. Please see the UNDRR-ISC 2020 Hazard Information Profiles report for more information.

linkhaz_occ_known.title: Is Linked Hazard Occurence Known or Potential
linkhaz_occ_known.description: Was the linked hazard actually observed to have occurred with the main hazard, or is this link only a potential link. In the Montandon, we allow for hazards to be linked together by actual observed occurrences, or the possibility that the linked hazard occurred with the principal hazard. This is especially useful when handling hazards such as tropical cyclones, whereby more than half of all deaths from cyclones in the US were actually caused by inland flooding.

linkhaz_occ_prob.title: Probability of Occurrence of Linked Hazard
linkhaz_occ_prob.description: As a string, describe the probability of occurrence of the linked hazard with the main hazard. Numbers can also be used, but must be placed inside quotations.

linkhaz_occ_probdef.title: URL to Definition of Probability of Occurrence
linkhaz_occ_probdef.description: Please provide a link to where the definition of occurrence probability is for the hazard relationship. For example, if the probability is 'high', where is 'high' defined?

relationship.title: Relationship Between Hazards
relationship.description: The relationship between this linked hazard to the main hazard instance of this object. Therefore, if this hazard object instance is an earthquake, and the user is linking a landslide to the earthquake hazard object and data, then the relationship would be 'linkhaz-triggered-by-mainhaz', as the landslide way triggered by the earthquake. However, if the hazard object instance was a landslide, and the linked hazard was the earthquake data, then we would use 'mainhaz-triggers-linkhaz'. For hazards that do not necessarily trigger one-another, but occur together, then we use 'concurrent-hazards'. For example, thunderstorms can occur together with windstorms or cyclones, thus, we would use 'concurrent'. When the relationship between two hazards is complex, use 'complex-relationship'. For all other relationships, add as you want, but let us know what we're missing!.

hazard_taxonomy.title: Hazard Taxonomy
hazard_taxonomy.description: Classification of this specific hazard, with respect to the UNDRR-ISC 2020 Hazard Information Profiles report.

haz_Ab.title: Abbreviated Hazard ID
haz_Ab.description: Two-letter abbreviated ID for the hazard. For example, floods would be 'FL' and earthquakes 'EQ'. These abbreviations are pre-determined and standardised, and should be found online.

haz_type.title: Hazard Type
haz_type.description: The most concise categorisation of the hazards, into eight categories. Please see the UNDRR-ISC 2020 Hazard Information Profiles report for more information.

haz_cluster.title: Hazard Cluster
haz_cluster.description: The second layer in the categorisation of the hazards. Please see the UNDRR-ISC 2020 Hazard Information Profiles report for more information.

haz_spec.title: Specific Hazard
haz_spec.description: The specific hazard is the final layer in the categorisation of the hazards. Please see the UNDRR-ISC 2020 Hazard Information Profiles report for more information.

temporal.title: Time-Related Data
temporal.description: Data related to dates and time periods of the hazard

haz_sdate.title: Hazard Start Date
haz_sdate.description: Starting date of this specific hazard. For unclear start dates, please use the earliest plausible date.

haz_fdate.title: Hazard End Date
haz_fdate.description: End date of this specific hazard. For unclear end dates, please use the latest plausible date. Please note that this is when the hazard ended, not when the post-disaster recovery was achieved.

spatial.title: Spatial-Related Data
spatial.description: Data related to the spatial coverage of the hazard

SpatialImpact_obj.title: Impact Spatial Data
SpatialImpact_obj.description: All information about the impact-specific spatial data.

ID_linkage.title: Spatial Impact Data IDs and Linkages
ID_linkage.description: Information about the IDs and linkages associated to this spatial impact data

imp_spat_ID.title: Impact Spatial ID
imp_spat_ID.description: ID of the spatial impact data

imp_spat_fileloc.title: Spatial Data File Location
imp_spat_fileloc.description: Location of where the spatial data can be found. Note that this can be either a local folder or a direct URL to the source.

imp_spat_colname.title: Spatial Data Column Indices
imp_spat_colname.description: Indices of the specific spatial file columns which are referred to by the impact estimate

imp_spat_rowname.title: Spatial Data Row Indices
imp_spat_rowname.description: Indices of the specific spatial file rows which are referred to by the impact estimate

spatial_info.title: Spatial Data Information
spatial_info.description: Information that is directly related to the spatial data itself, such as the form: raster, point, line or polygon.

imp_ISO3s.title: Country ISO3 Codes
imp_ISO3s.description: List of countries affected, by ISO3 code.

imp_spat_scale.title: Spatial Scale
imp_spat_scale.description: The geographical scale of the data: sub-national, national or multi-national.

imp_spat_type.title: Impact Spatial Data Type
imp_spat_type.description: The spatial data type of a given spatial dataset. For example, spatial polygon data which is of administrative boundaries and at admin-level 2. You would enter 'adminlevel' here, which is the correct coded name for administrative boundary spatial data.

imp_spat_fileread.title: File Type and Software
imp_spat_fileread.description: Information on the specific spatial data file format, including providing an understanding of which specific software should be used to read the files.

imp_spat_res.title: Impact Spatial Resolution Value
imp_spat_res.description: The resolution of the given spatial dataset. For example, spatial polygon data which is of administrative boundaries and at admin-level 2. You would enter '2' here.

imp_spat_resunits.title: Impact Spatial Resolution Units
imp_spat_resunits.description: The units of the resolution of the given spatial dataset.

imp_spat_crs.title: Impact Spatial Data Coordinate System
imp_spat_crs.description: The spatial coordinate reference system code of the given spatial dataset, such as EPSG:4326. Note that this can either be in ESRI or EPSG format

source.title: Source Information of Impact Spatial Data
source.description: Information regarding the source of the spatial data of the impact estimate

imp_spat_srcdb.title: Impact Spatial Data Source Database
imp_spat_srcdb.description: The database name from where the spatial data of the impact estimate depends

imp_spat_srcorg.title: Impact Spatial Data Source Organisation
imp_spat_srcorg.description: The organisation who published the spatial data used by the impact estimate

imp_spat_URL.title: Impact Spatial Data Source URL
imp_spat_URL.description: The website URL where the spatial data of the impact estimate can be found

SpatialHazard_obj.title: Hazard Spatial Data
SpatialHazard_obj.description: All information about the hazard-specific spatial data.

ID_linkage.title: Spatial Hazard Data IDs and Linkages
ID_linkage.description: Information about the IDs and linkages associated to this spatial hazard data

haz_spat_ID.title: Hazard Spatial ID
haz_spat_ID.description: ID of the spatial hazard data

haz_spat_fileloc.title: Spatial Data File Location
haz_spat_fileloc.description: Location of where the spatial data can be found. Note that this can be either a local folder or a direct URL to the source.

haz_spat_colname.title: Spatial Data Column Indices
haz_spat_colname.description: Indices of the specific spatial file columns which are referred to by the hazard data.

haz_spat_rowname.title: Spatial Data Row Indices
haz_spat_rowname.description: Indices of the specific spatial file rows which are referred to by the hazard data

spatial_info.title: Spatial Data Information
spatial_info.description: Information that is directly related to the spatial data itself, such as the countries associated to the area, or the data form: raster, point, line or polygon.

haz_ISO3s.title: Country ISO3 Codes
haz_ISO3s.description: List of countries affected, by ISO3 code.

haz_spat_scale.title: Spatial Scale
haz_spat_scale.description: The geographical scale of the data: sub-national, national or multi-national.

haz_spat_type.title: Hazard Spatial Data Type
haz_spat_type.description: The spatial data type of a given spatial dataset.

haz_spat_fileread.title: File Type and Software
haz_spat_fileread.description: Information on the specific spatial data file format, including providing an understanding of which specific software should be used to read the files.

haz_spat_res.title: Hazard Spatial Resolution Value
haz_spat_res.description: The resolution of the given spatial dataset.

haz_spat_resunits.title: Hazard Spatial Resolution Units
haz_spat_resunits.description: The units of the resolution of the given spatial dataset, such as arc-seconds or admin-level.

haz_spat_crs.title: Hazard Spatial Data Coordinate System
haz_spat_crs.description: The spatial coordinate reference system code of the given spatial dataset, such as EPSG-4326.

haz_spat_unit.title: Hazard Spatial Data Units
haz_spat_unit.description: The units of the given spatial hazard dataset, given the IFRC units category found in the Impact Information Profiles tabular data. For example, the Richter scale could be used for earthquakes.

source.title: Source Information of Hazard Spatial Data
source.description: Information regarding the source of the spatial data of the hazard data

haz_spat_srcdb.title: Hazard Spatial Data Source Database
haz_spat_srcdb.description: The database name from where the spatial data of the hazard data depends

haz_spat_srcorg.title: Hazard Spatial Data Source Organisation
haz_spat_srcorg.description: The organisation who published the spatial data used by the hazard data

haz_spat_URL.title: Hazard Spatial Data Source URL
haz_spat_URL.description: The website URL where the spatial data of the hazard data can be found

ISO3_obj.title: ISO-3C Codes
ISO3_obj.description: 3-letter abbreviated country codes (as characters), with respect to the ISO 3166 standard.

ExtIDs_obj.title: External ID Codes
ExtIDs_obj.description: Any IDs, such as the GLIDE number ID, that are linked to this specific event
